mjc.analysis

Class SymbolTableBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • mjc.analysis.SymbolTableBuilder

  • public class SymbolTableBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
    Symbol table builder.

    A SymbolTableBuilder builds a symbol table from the AST. It does so in two passes. In the first pass, information about declared classes are added. In the second pass the builder goes deeper and adds information about declared fields, methods and variables.

    Errors are collected during the building process, and may be queried for using hasErrors() and getErrors().

    It is OK to proceed with type checking even if errors occurred during symbol table construction: The constructed table is still complete, but:

    - Fields, parameters, local variables and methods with undeclared types / return types will have been entered with the UndefinedType type.

    - Redeclared methods and classes will have been entered under new unique name and the AST will have been updated to match.

        public SymbolTable build(mjc.node.Start tree)
        Builds and returns a symbol table from the given AST.

        If errors occurred, they may be queried for using hasErrors() and getErrors().

        Returns:
        A symbol table constructed from the AST.
